availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James T. Cornelison (Madison County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farmer. Married to Tabitha Johnson Cornelison in Madison County on May 16, 1844. Father of Mary A. Cornelison and James E. Cornelison. Farmer in Madison County in 1860. Signed letter to Governor Beriah Magoffin on March 11, 1861 stating intention to serve in a militia company from Richmond, Kentucky.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Madison County Marriages, 1786-1877, Film # 000183302, p. 248
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 330.
KYR-0002-022-0114
_ Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989_, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Madison County Administrator Bonds, 1830-1869; Vol 19-20, 1970-1975 (Accessed through ancestry.com on September 17, 2019), p. 723 of microfilm.
